page.title: 19GUNNESS VILLAGE (1)
page.content: The village of{Gunness}is 3.5 miles west of{Scunthorpe},18 miles east of {Doncaster},175 miles from London.In the 1700s it was known as{"Gunny"}and in the 1800s as{"Gunhouse"}due to an abbatoir built in 1822.It lies on the banks of the river{Trent}next to wharfs.(It owns half the river.) There are 278 homes,3 farms,1 General Store & Post Office,a petrol filling station and a repair garage;St. Barnabas church(C.of E.) & a Wesleyan chapel.Population is 1000 approx. Land area is 2037 acres approx.The soil is alluvial,warp(rich from the river). The chief crops are barley,wheat, rape seed and potatoes. The three farms are run by the same families as for many years.The "Gunhouse", originally an abbattoir is now a joinery business and D.I.Y. Suppliers.
